1. Transitioning in flight accounts from a part-time CL to myself: This has been a year in the making but probably one of the toughest experiences at Rise8 was taking on accounts in flight, which meant establishing a new kind of working relationship with delivery members who weren't used to having full time support or understood the value CS could bring to the table. It also meant building strong and effective relationships with customers who already had a POC within leadership or with the delivery teams and were hesitant to commit time to a new person and a role they are unfamiliar with. While I don't think JJ will ever stop texting Carlo ;), I am proud of how far I have come and Rise8 has come into turning CS into a highly valued function within the company and for our customers. I think this was a foundational year building trust and winning hearts/minds to really give CS the autonomy to guide account strategies with customers next year. 
2. In that vein, I am proud of piloting leadership alignment sessions with customers this year and building a muscle with customers on aligning business value and openly discussing whether Rise8 and the customer are on the same page about the value we bring. 
3. Account strategies and piloting account strategic discussions bringing together delivery teams, delivery leadership, and growth so we can have active conversations on renewal, expansion, and risks.
